metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5420 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
curl and libcurl before 7.50.1 do not check the client certificate whenchoosing the TLS connection to reuse, which might allow remote attackers tohijack the authentication of the connection by leveraging a previouslycreated connection with a different client certificate.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5420` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

curl - 7.47.0-1ubuntu2.1
libcurl3 - 7.47.0-1ubuntu2.1
libcurl3-gnutls - 7.47.0-1ubuntu2.1
libcurl3-nss - 7.47.0-1ubuntu2.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: curl package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.47.0-1ubuntu2.1').
